text:
Hey Folks, I was having trouble suppressing the display of code in `Weave.jl`. So I wanted to suppress this code, but it keeps showing up despite trying different combinations. Can anyone suggest what I am doing wrong?
``` ```julia; echo = false,
 using Dates, Plots;
 ``````
I followed the instructions in the documentation, but for some reason the `using Dates, Plots'` still shows up.

text: Can we cross post this publicly to <https://discourse.julialang.org|Discourse> for further visibility? React with :bridge: on the message above to approve. <https://github.com/JuliaCommunity/SlackBridge/blob/main/README.md#faq|More info here>

Success, it has been cross posted <https://discourse.julialang.org/t/57099| to Discourse>. Keep and eye out on Discourse for responses and please add an answer there once you are satisfied with the solution so others can benefit as well. Happy debugging!
Should there be a comma at the end of the first line?

elements.text: Should there be a comma at the end of the first line?

text:
<@USU9FRPEU> the documentation says it is okay. I tried with a `;` as well, but that did not work. according to the docs, these are all equivalent.
``` ```julia; echo = false; out_width = "12cm"

 ```{julia; echo = false; out_width = "12cm"}

 ```julia, echo = false, out_width = "12cm"

 ```{julia, echo = false, out_width = "12cm"}```

as well, but that did not work. according to the docs, these are all equivalent.

text: <@USU9FRPEU> but that was a good suggestion. Thanks for taking a look.

text: It seems like there is a space ' ' before your chunk, try to remove those spaces and it should work :slightly_smiling_face:

elements.text: It seems like there is a space ' ' before your chunk, try to remove those spaces and it should work

text: <@U01NTLUQ6Q2> Oh my goodness, thanks so much. I was just racking my brain trying to figure it out. I am using vscode, so still getting used to it. I think vscode might be indenting my blocks, and inserting spaces that I can't see, haha. Thanks so much. I will keep an eye out for that happening in the future.

text: Hey <@UDDSTBX19>, if you were able to find an answer here on Slack, please cross post it to Discourse via the link above. Thank you!
